intro: Tetramerium denudatum, commonly known as the naked tetramerium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
